nodes.bodyText: I'd prefer boolean to Boolean. Boolean allows the value to be set to null which can cause unexpected issues.

I don't think we should actually be adding this. For TokenParam unlike StringParam, the match should always be equality, i.e., so instead of propertyLike("t.uuid", tag), we should really just be doing eq("t.uuid", tag).

See above.
critieria.add(eq("t.name", tag.getValue()))
parent should be defined as a referenceParam. See the definition here.
If you're going to do something like this, used DetachedCriteria instead of Criteria.
private LocationService locationService
As this is a public method, it should be near the top of the class.
These should be StringOrListParams
This should be a ReferenceParam or, better, a ReferenceOrListParam. Note you can add searches for additional properties as we do for Patient elsewhere.

Similarly here
		assertThat(locations.iterator().next().getCountry(),equalTo(LOCATION_COUNTRY));

similarly here
		assertThat(locations.iterator().next().getPostalCode(),equalTo(POSTAL_CODE));

Here
		assertThat(locations.iterator().next().getStateProvince(),equalTo(LOCATION_STATE));

Here something like this might work
		assertThat(locations.iterator().next().getTags().iterator().next().getLocationTagId(),equalTo(LOCATIONT_TAG));
You can replace the literal "_tag" by PARAM_TAG present in ca.uhn.fhir.rest.api.Constants

nodes.bodyText: I prefer to have a space before the return line.
I'd group these with the other handle... calls.

givenName really only applies to things with a PersonName (OpenMRS) or HumanName (FHIR). This should just be called name, i.e., it gets called "givenName" to distinguish it from "familyName" (it makes a bit more sense in French where they're, respectively, "prénom" and "nom"). Very European-parochial.
Ditto on removing given
Ditto given
Ditto given
The tag parameter should be called tags
Ditto given.
Why is this here instead of in the LocationDaoImpl? Unlike other reference handlers, this is pretty specific to Locations.

We shouldn't expect a locationId passed in here. We should expect a uuid for the location instead. Generally speaking, except for the special case of concepts, we should only be dealing with UUIDs (concepts are special for historical reasons).
I concur with @VaishSiddharth here and elsewhere. We should be checking that the property we're querying by is in the actual results.
I wouldn't import this statically for consistency with the other parameters.
We actually do want most of these tests, even if they need to be modified.

This should actually be .setValue(...).setChain(...) and so on for the others. The reason is that the .setValue() method resets the value of the chain. This will probably fix the coverage.
